marketNews.title: Israel Accuses Iran of Ceasefire Violation
marketNews.content: The Chief of Staff of the Israel Defense Forces, Eyal Zamir, said on Tuesday (24/6) that Israel will respond to Iran "with force" after accusing Iran of violating the ceasefire agreement. Previously, the US government along with Qatar on Monday night (23/6) attempted to push Israel and Iran to reach a ceasefire by stopping their respective attacks, according to an Axios report. Axios continued that both parties had agreed to the ceasefire before US President Donald Trump announced it on the same night. However, Israel accused Iran of violating the agreement, with Israel claiming to have detected missile launches from Iran after the ceasefire. On the contrary, the Iranian military and state media denied Israel's accusations. Although Israel threatened to respond to Iran "with force," Trump announced on Tuesday (24/6) that the ceasefire between Israel and Iran was officially in effect. Responding to recent developments, Brent futures prices for the August 2025 contract moved volatile throughout Tuesday (24/6) trading. Nevertheless, Tuesday's (24/6) intraday price at 69.1 US dollars per barrel (-3.3%) as of Tuesday afternoon was a continuation of the -7.2% drop on Monday (23/6), following Iran's failure to close the Strait of Hormuz and news of the ceasefire agreement. Meanwhile, stock markets reacted positively on Tuesday (24/6) with Nikkei +1.16%, SSE +1.15%, and IHSG +1.21%. S&P Futures strengthened by +0.74% as of Tuesday afternoon after the S&P 500 rose +1% in Monday's (23/6) trading local time. Gold prices fell -1.26% to the level of 3,327 as of Tuesday afternoon.

tickerNews.title: Key Takeaway from Market Movement amid Ceasefire Talks
tickerNews.content: The significant drop in oil prices caused a correction in several oil and gas related stocks such as ENRG (-9.33%), MEDC (-8.97%), and ELSA (-5.20%) during Tuesday's (24/6) trading after experiencing a rally since the start of the Israel-Iran conflict. Meanwhile, the still positive movement in the stock market amidst accusations of ceasefire violations indicates market participants' optimism that the de-escalation progress of the conflict is generally moving in a positive direction.

tickerNews.title: Danantara Injects US$405 Million into GIAA
tickerNews.content: 1. GIAA: Danantara's BPI officially injected capital of 405 million US dollars or equivalent to ~6.65 trillion Rupiah into Garuda Indonesia on Tuesday (24/6), marking Danantara's first investment since its establishment in early 2025. The capital injection was provided in the form of a shareholder loan and is part of a total financing designed to reach 1 billion US dollars. GIAA's President Director, Wamildan Tsani, stated that in the initial stage, the obtained funds will be focused on maintenance and improving the operational readiness of the Garuda and Citilink fleets. Previously, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday (4/6) that GIAA was exploring a capital injection of 500 million US dollars from Danantara in two stages.

tickerNews.title: Amman Mineral Internasional Director Sells Shares
tickerNews.content: 2. AMMN: Amman Mineral Internasional Director, David Alexander Gibbs, sold ~39.5 million AMMN shares at an average price of ~7,991 Rupiah per share on June 16-19, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~315.9 billion Rupiah. Following this transaction, David Alexander Gibbs' ownership in AMMN decreased from 0.109% to 0.055%.

tickerNews.title: Ultrajaya Announces Share Buyback Plan
tickerNews.content: 3. ULTJ: Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company announced a buyback plan of up to ~1 billion (10%) shares in the period of June 25 to September 25, 2025. The estimated fund for this buyback is 1.45 trillion Rupiah. This plan does not require GMS approval, in line with the relaxation provided by OJK to support capital market stability. Previously, ULTJ had announced a buyback plan in March 2025, but stated that the plan had not been realized due to still fluctuating market conditions.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors Sales Performance Update (May 2025)
tickerNews.content: 4. UNTR: United Tractors recorded Komatsu brand heavy equipment sales of 463 units in May 2025 (-7.6% MoM, +29.7% YoY). Cumulatively over 5M25, Komatsu heavy equipment sales reached 2,349 units (+33.7% YoY), equivalent to 51% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units, with a market share at 26% (vs. 4M25: 26%, 5M24: 28%). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 55.1 million tons (-3.5% YoY) during 5M25, with overburden removal at 434 million bcm (-11.4% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Semen Indonesia Sales Volume Decline (May 2025)
tickerNews.content: 5. SMGR: Semen Indonesia recorded a decline in cement sales volume of -5.4% YoY in May 2025, following domestic sales which dropped -9.6% YoY despite a +29% MoM rise post-Eid al-Fitr. Based on segments, the contribution of bagged cement sales was 71.6% in May 2025 (vs. April 2025: 74.7%) and 72.1% during 5M25 (vs. 4M25: 72.2%). During 5M25, SMGR sales volume decreased -0.3% YoY (vs. 5M24: +0.1% YoY), performing better than the industry sales which fell -2.1% YoY (vs. 5M24: +2.8% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Pyridam Farma Plans Bond Issuance
tickerNews.content: 6. PYFA: Pyridam Farma plans to issue bonds up to 420 billion Rupiah, with the proceeds intended for the repayment of 2023 bonds and working capital for the company. The bonds have obtained an irA- rating from PT Kredit Rating Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: Steel Pipe Industry of Indonesia to Distribute Cash Dividend
tickerNews.content: 7. ISSP: Steel Pipe Industry of Indonesia will distribute 2024 fiscal year cash dividends of ~112.82 billion Rupiah or 16 Rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a ~21.3% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~21.3%) and indicates a dividend yield of ~4.8% as of Tuesday (24/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is July 1, 2025, while payment is scheduled for July 24, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Danantara to Cooperate with Pertamina Geothermal Energy on Geothermal Development
tickerNews.content: 8. PGEO: Danantara's BPI will cooperate with Pertamina Geothermal Energy regarding geothermal energy development of 3 GW. The required investment value is not yet known, however, PGEO previously stated that it is opening cooperation opportunities with Danantara in the development of geothermal plants with a target capacity of 1.8 GW by 2033 with an investment need reaching 6-7 billion US dollars.

tickerNews.title: Russia to Invest Over $10 Billion in Upstream Oil and Gas Sector
tickerNews.content: 1. Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, claimed that Russia will invest more than 10 billion US dollars or around 164.8 trillion Rupiah in Indonesia's upstream oil and gas sector. Bahlil mentioned that this investment will be allocated for the exploration activities of old, less productive oil and gas fields utilizing technology from Russia, where one of the targeted locations is the Tuna Block off the northern coast of Natuna. Bahlil claimed that the details of the investment value from Russia to work on these old wells will only be known after representatives from that country arrive in Indonesia this week.

tickerNews.title: Gaia Artha Dinamic Increases Share Ownership in Sumber Sinergi Makmur ($IOTF)
tickerNews.content: 2. PT Gaia Artha Dinamic (GAIA) on June 23, 2025, increased its share ownership in Sumber Sinergi Makmur (IOTF) by 90.8 million shares (1.72%) valued at 11.35 billion Rupiah or at an average price of 125 Rupiah per share. With this purchase, GAIA's ownership increased to ~369.3 million shares (6.98%).

tickerNews.title: Logindo Samudramakmur Announces Ship Sale
tickerNews.content: 3. Logindo Samudramakmur (LEAD) announced the sale of 1 vessel for 965,000 US dollars or ~1.6 billion Rupiah, aimed at increasing cash and partially paying off the company's loans.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia's Palm Oil Stock Increased in April 2025
tickerNews.content: 4. Indonesia's Crude Palm Oil (CPO) stock increased by +50% month-on-month (MoM) to 3.04 million tons in April 2025, marking the highest level since May 2024, based on records from the Indonesian Palm Oil Producers Association (GAPKI). The stock increase was mainly caused by a decrease in export volume of -38.1% MoM to 1.78 million tons due to reduced demand. According to a trader from New Delhi, CPO exports increased in May 2025 thanks to CPO prices being traded at a relative discount compared to competing oils, thus likely lowering stock levels.

tickerNews.title: Charnic Capital Increases Ownership in Fuji Finance Indonesia ($FUJI)
tickerNews.content: 5. Fuji Finance Indonesia (FUJI) shareholder, Charnic Capital (NICK), bought 130 million FUJI shares at an average price of 40 Rupiah per share on June 23, 2025, from PT Okansa Fuji Shosha. The total transaction value reached 5.2 billion Rupiah and was intended as an investment strategy. After this transaction, NICK's ownership in FUJI increased from 13.48% to 23.48%.
